body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do       Yellowstone has something for everyone. Whether you delight in the challenge of a strenuous hike or prefer to sit quietly and watch the sunset, the park offers a great diversity of activities for you to enjoy. With so many adventures to choose from, you’ll have some tough decisions to make.            Backcountry Camping & Hiking  Carry your backpack and stay in more than 300 backcountry campsites            Boating  Take in the view from the water            Bicycling  Enjoy the scenery on two wheels            Camping   Pitch your tent, or pull-up your RV, at one of 12 campgrounds            Cross Country Skiing and Snowshoeing  Hear the crunch of snow under your feet            Day Hiking  Lace up your boots and walk more than 1,000 miles of trails            Fishing   Cast your line for 16 species of fish            Guided Tours & Other Services These businesses are authorized to provide day hiking, backpacking, bicycling, boating, horseback riding, snowmobiling, wildlife viewing, fishing tours, and more in Yellowstone.           Horseback Riding and Llama Packing  Bring your own stock or take a guided ride            Picnicking  Unpack your basket at 52 picnic areas throughout the park            Ranger Activities Join a park ranger for walks, hikes, and campfire programs            Snowmobiles and Snowcoaches  Take a guided tour in the winter            Wildlife Viewing  Test your observation skills with 67 species of mammals, 330 species of birds, 5 amphibians, and 6 reptiles             Every Kid in a Park: Visiting Yellowstone Get trip ideas for visiting Yellowstone with kids in summer and winter. Read our Top Kid and Family Activities...       More Information  Let's Move Outside Junior Ranger: Kids can earn an extra sticker for their Junior Ranger program for having an active visit to Yellowstone.
title: Yellowstone National Park: Things To Do
